Observation of network sessions with sig.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log and http.log to identify sessions with significantly higher 'orig_bytes' than 'resp_bytes' connecting to common web service ports (80, 443). Calculate the ratio of outbound to inbound bytes for sessions over a certain size threshold. Use descriptive statistics and outlier detection (e.g., IQR, box plots) on the byte ratio distribution per destination domain/IP and user to flag unusual data asymmetry.

Network connections originating from unu.Action: Correlate Zeek conn.log data with Windows Event ID 4688 logs (collected from endpoints/servers) to identify the process associated with outbound web service connections. Identify connections to destinations not commonly seen for that host/user. Use frequency analysis or time series analysis to detect new or unusual connections and processes making large outbound transfers to web services.
